item.title: Report E-2024090162
item.description:
Report E-2024090162

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-13T09:14:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-29
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal BCO experienced a UN3266 Chem-Aqua 52885 release from a 20-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Terminal personnel overpacked the damaged drum into a metal overpack prior to contractors’ arrival. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 5’ x 5’ area of the concrete dock floor. The drum was punctured during unloading. Contractors containerized the damaged 20-gallon poly drum into a 55-gallon poly overpack. The contaminated metal drum was placed into a second 55-gallon poly drum along with impacted absorbents used to clean the release. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024090170
item.description:
Report E-2024090170

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-13T09:14:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-14
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-BCO contacted ERTS to report a spill. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and dispatched Clean Harbors to assist with cleanup. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the top and side of the tote and estimated that half a gallon (0.5) of material was released due to the lid being loose. Clean Harbors personnel tightened the lid, deployed absorbents, and then cleaned the released material. The recovered material and spent absorbents were placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024090133
item.description:
Report E-2024090133

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-12T09:14:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-29
  • City: GARFIELD HEIGHTS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 29, 2024, eight (8) 5-gallon pails of ULTRA-CURE SB UV Topcoat Low Gloss were dented due to a faulty skid and released approximately one (1) quart of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. he customer chose which metal pails he would accept, and FCE personnel removed the rejected metal pails for waste. Eight (8) 5-gallon metal pails were placed into four (4) 55-gallon drums that were labeled as recovered materials, and placed back on the trailer, for return to the Norwalk terminal. The customer said he did not require remediation of the loading dock floor, so crews received his signature that cleanup efforts were complete

item.title: Report E-2024090073
item.description:
Report E-2024090073

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-08T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-21
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 21, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of ink was crushed in transit and released approximately one and a half (1.5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. LE personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and cleaners to remediate the site. All spent absorbents and waste were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums to be staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024090089
item.description:
Report E-2024090089

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-08T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-12
  • City: SEVILLE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When driver stopped for the night and was doing his post trip inspection he noticed that there were some liquid dripping on the trailer tires. The driver then put down some absorbent and call our emergency number. The team was dispatched to address the leaking container. The team showed up and Identified the container that was leaking. They needed to get extra equipment out there to gain better access to the drum so they stopped the leak and requested further equipment. The equipment showed up by 0600 on 8/13/24 and they then gained access to the container cleaning any left over residue and disposing of the absorbent appropriately. The damaged drum was placed into a salvage drum and rescued in the trailer for shipment. The clean up was completed by 0800.

item.title: Report E-2024090098
item.description:
Report E-2024090098

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-08T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-07
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO notified ERTS of a 100-gallon release of UN2810, Proxel TN Preservative. ERTS dispatched First Call Environmental to assist with cleanup. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 20ft-by-20ft area of the concrete dock trailer floor and estimated that one hundred (100) gallons of material was released due to a forklift damaging one (1) plastic tote. First Call Environmental neutralized the impacted area, deployed absorbents, and cleaned the released material. The damaged tote and recovered material were placed into six (6) 55-gallon poly drums and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization.
